title: Country X comp. adv., labor market data, PPC

content.description:
Countries face trade-offs between producing consumer goods and producing capital goods.

Country X takes one hour to produce a unit of consumer goods and two hours to produce a unit of capital goods. Country Y takes two hours to produce a unit of consumer goods and four hours to produce a unit of capital goods. Which country has a comparative advantage in the production of consumer goods? Explain.

The following table shows labor-market data for Country X.

Calculate the unemployment rate in Country X. Show your work.

Calculate the labor force participation rate in Country X. Show your work.

Draw a correctly labeled graph of the production possibilities curve for Country X, with consumer goods on the horizontal axis and capital goods on the vertical axis. Indicate a point on your graph, labeled Z, that reflects the current level of unemployment.

The text boxÂ should be used for notes only and not your final response.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 1.2: Opportunity Cost and the Production Possibilities Curve (PPC)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
